name: The Blue Note
description: A smoky jazz club with a lingering air of secrets. A piano plays in the corner. Mick polishes glasses behind the counter.
The blinds cast crooked shadows across a desk littered with old case files and empty glasses. Rain drums steadily against the windowpane.
Dim lighting. A haze of smoke hangs in the air as a saxophone moans through the static of an old speaker. Red curtains hang heavy behind the stage.
A narrow passage soaked in neon and rain. Broken bottles glint in puddles, and something shifts behind the trash bins.
Flickering lights illuminate rows of old lockers. The air smells of rust, oil, and distant train brakes.
A massive steel door blocks the way. Graffiti scrawled across the surface almost hides a worn plaque: 'Warehouse 12.'
Stacks of crates rise like mausoleums in the dust-heavy air. A single bulb sways gently overhead, casting long shadows that don’t quite sit still.
Water laps quietly against rotting piers. A ship sits anchored in darkness. Somewhere, a gull screams.
Bare bulbs flicker over worn linoleum. Doors line the hall like silent witnesses to a thousand forgotten arguments.
The street glistens under rainfall and lamplight. Cars pass like ghosts. The city never really sleeps — it just waits.
